016package de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer;
017
018import de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.renderer.VerifyComponentRendererConfig;
019import de.cuioss.test.jsf.config.renderer.VetoRenderAttributeAssert;
020import de.cuioss.test.jsf.renderer.util.DomUtils;
021import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.FieldWrapper;
022import de.cuioss.tools.reflect.MoreReflection;
023import jakarta.faces.component.UIComponent;
024import jakarta.faces.component.UIViewRoot;
025import jakarta.faces.component.html.HtmlForm;
026import jakarta.faces.event.FacesEvent;
027import jakarta.faces.event.PostAddToViewEvent;
028import jakarta.faces.render.Renderer;
029import lombok.Getter;
030import org.junit.jupiter.api.BeforeEach;
031import org.junit.jupiter.api.Test;
032
033import java.util.*;
034
035import static de.cuioss.tools.collect.CollectionLiterals.mutableList;
036import static org.junit.jupiter.api.Assertions.assertDoesNotThrow;
037
038/**
039 * While {@link AbstractRendererTestBase} focuses on API-Contract utility
040 * methods, this class provides a number of implicit tests. Simplifying the
041 * testing of concrete renderer behavior.
042 * <h3>Configuration</h3> You can configure this test by
043 * <ul>
044 * <li>{@link VerifyComponentRendererConfig}</li>
045 * <li>{@link VetoRenderAttributeAssert}</li>
046 * </ul>
047 *
048 * @param <R> The renderer being tested
049 * @author Oliver Wolff
050 */
051public abstract class AbstractComponentRendererTest<R extends Renderer> extends AbstractRendererTestBase<R> {
052
053    @Getter
054    private Set<RendererAttributeAssert> activeAsserts;
055
056    @Getter
057    private boolean wrapComponentInForm = false;
058
059    /**
060     * Initializes the active {@link RendererAttributeAssert} and checks for the
061     * {@link VerifyComponentRendererConfig} annotation
062     */
063    @BeforeEach
064    public void initAbstractComponentRendererTest() {
065        handleRenderAttributeAsserts();
066        handleConfigAnnotation();
067    }
068
069    private void handleConfigAnnotation() {
070        Optional<VerifyComponentRendererConfig> configOption = MoreReflection.extractAnnotation(getClass(),
071            VerifyComponentRendererConfig.class);
072        configOption.ifPresent(verifyComponentRendererConfig -> wrapComponentInForm = verifyComponentRendererConfig
073            .wrapComponentInForm());
074    }
075
076    private void handleRenderAttributeAsserts() {
077        activeAsserts = new HashSet<>(Arrays.asList(CommonRendererAsserts.values()));
078        final Set<CommonRendererAsserts> vetoes = new HashSet<>();
079        MoreReflection.extractAllAnnotations(this.getClass(), VetoRenderAttributeAssert.class)
080            .forEach(veto -> vetoes.addAll(mutableList(veto.value())));
081        activeAsserts.removeAll(vetoes);
082    }
083
084    /**
085     * Iterates through all active RendererAttributeAssert and tests them
086     * accordingly
087     */
088    @Test
089    public void shouldHandleRendererAttributeAsserts() {
090        for (RendererAttributeAssert attributeAssert : activeAsserts) {
091            var component = getWrappedComponent();
092            attributeAssert.applyAttribute(component);
093            component.processEvent(new PostAddToViewEvent(component));
094            var document = DomUtils.htmlStringToDocument(assertDoesNotThrow(() -> super.renderToString(component)));
095            attributeAssert.assertAttributeSet(document.getRootElement());
096        }
097    }
098
099    /**
100     * @return the {@link UIComponent} derived by {@link #getComponent()} or the
101     * same wrapped in an {@link HtmlForm} in case
102     * {@link #isWrapComponentInForm()} is {@code true}
103     */
104    protected UIComponent getWrappedComponent() {
105        var component = getComponent();
106        if (wrapComponentInForm) {
107            var form = new HtmlForm();
108            form.getChildren().add(component);
109        }
110        return component;
111    }
112
113    /**
114     * Helper method that extracts all queued events from {@link UIViewRoot}. In
115     * order to use this method the corresponding test must ensure, that the
116     * component under test is child of {@link UIViewRoot}. Otherwise the events can
117     * not be extracted
118     *
119     * @return the plain list of events available at {@link UIViewRoot} at this
120     * time.
121     */
122    // owolff: Sonar false-positive
123    @SuppressWarnings({"unchecked"})
124    public List<FacesEvent> extractEventsFromViewRoot() {
125        final List<FacesEvent> found = new ArrayList<>();
126        final var uiViewRoot = getFacesContext().getViewRoot();
127        // Hacky: Private field of myfaces
128        var eventField = FieldWrapper.from(UIViewRoot.class, "_events");
129        if (eventField.isPresent()) {
130            var events = eventField.get().readValue(uiViewRoot);
131            events.ifPresent(o -> found.addAll((Collection<? extends FacesEvent>) o));
132            return found;
133        }
134        // Hacky: Private field of mojarra
135        eventField = FieldWrapper.from(UIViewRoot.class, "events");
136        if (eventField.isEmpty()) {
137            throw new AssertionError(
138                "javax.faces.component.UIViewRoot provides neither the field 'events' nor '_events'");
139        }
140        var events = eventField.get().readValue(uiViewRoot);
141        if (events.isPresent()) {
142            var eventLists = (List<List<FacesEvent>>) events.get();
143            eventLists.forEach(found::addAll);
144        }
145        return found;
146
147    }
148
149}
